conclusion: The coil is a square with side length L. It has N turns. The coil is in a uniform magnetic field B. The coil rotates with angular velocity ω around an axis perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The induced EMF in a coil rotating in a magnetic field is given by: 𝓔 = N B A ω sin(ω t).
N is the number of turns. B is the magnetic field strength. A is the area of the coil. ω is the angular velocity. sin(ω t) accounts for the rotation.
The area A of the square coil is: A = L^2.

premise: The maximum induced EMF occurs when sin(ω t) = 1.
conclusion: The maximum induced EMF is: 𝓔_max = N B L^2 ω.

premise: The effective value of the induced EMF is given by: 𝓔_eff = 𝓔_max / √2.
conclusion: Substitute the maximum EMF into the effective value formula: 𝓔_eff = N B L^2 ω / √2.

premise: The effective value of the induced EMF is 𝓔_eff = N B L^2 ω / √2.
conclusion: The effective value of the induced electromotive force in the coil is: 𝓔_eff = (√2/2) N B L^2 ω.
